Key Match Events: Clarke Schmidt walked Shohei Ohtani on four pitches to start the game
Freddie Freeman hit a two-run homer with one out
Clarke Schmidt was unable to get out of the third inning
Mark Leiter Jr. entered and got Will Smith on a come-backer to keep the score 3-0
Pre-Game Insights: David Cone, who faced a 2-0 series deficit in the World Series in 1996, said his mindset was to avoid the big inning early and give his team a chance to get a lead
Post-Match Reflections: Clarke Schmidt said he didn't do his job tonight
Aaron Boone pulled Schmidt from the game in the third inning
Cone noted Schmidt's confidence and said he should be able to execute his pitches
Miscellaneous Highlights: This was the Yankees' season-ending loss in the World Series
Shohei Ohtani was hindered by a shoulder injury he suffered sliding into second base in Game 2
Freddie Freeman has homered in all three games in this series and each of his last five World Series games
Others: Clarke Schmidt started just his third postseason game
Schmidt needed 68 pitches to get just eight outs
